question:
In light of October 14th being observed as the World Standards Day, consider the following statements about BIS:
  1. The Bureau of Indian Standards is a statutory body.
  2. It falls under the consumer affairs ministry.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Bureau of Indian Standards was set up by the BIS Act of 1986. It is the national standards body of India. The institution was previously known as the Indian Standards Institution that was set up in 1946. The Indian Standards Bill, 2015 sought to replace the BIS Act, 1986. Statement 2 is correct:        The BIS falls under the ministry of consumer affairs, food and public distribution. The ex-officio president of BIS is the minister in charge of the department that administratively controls the BIS. BIS is involved in formulating standards and promotion of the same. It also certifies products for both Indian and foreign manufacturers.
